text:
Vermillion is a city in Marshall County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 112 people lived there.
History.
Vermillion was created in 1869 by the railroad company. It was named from the Black Vermillion River.
The first post office in Vermillion was created in May 1870.
Geography.
Vermillion is at (39.718860, -96.265214). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. Of that, is land and is water.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 112 people, 54 households, and 28 families living in Vermillion.
